fpmExplorer:Page.title: Draft Validation
fpmExplorer:Page.introduction: When editing an Object Page, pressing 'Enter' in a field can trigger backend validation: depending on the entity and annotations, SAP Fiori elements may execute global SideEffects or a PreparationAction to fetch draft-related messages immediately.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Defining Global Side Effects
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Global side effects are those side effects that are defined without any source properties or source entities. Global side effects can be annotated under each entity separately.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Fallback without Global Side Effect
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: If Enter is pressed on a control bound to an entity without a global side effect, SAP Fiori elements checks the parent entity for side effects; if none are found, it triggers the draft prepare action and retrieves messages if these are annotated.
